Vol 4: Poverty and Abstinence

And if one recites the ten seven-times-repeated [verses] that Al-Khidr (peace be upon him) gifted to Ibrahim Al-Taymi (may Allah have mercy on him) and advised him to say them morning and evening, then he has attained complete virtue and gathered for...

Verse 114:1
Vol 1: Secrets of Prayer

If his standing, facing (the Qibla), and bowing his head have become balanced in this manner, then let him recite 'Say: I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind (Qul a'udhu bi-rabbi al-nas)' as a fortification with it from Satan. Then let him come with...

Verse 114:1
Vol 1: Etiquette of Quran Recitation

The eighth [practice] is that he should say at the beginning of his recitation: 'I seek refuge with Allah, the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing, from the accursed Satan (Shaytan).' 'My Lord (Rabb), I seek refuge with You from the whisperings of the devil...

Verse 114:4
Vol 3: Wonders of the Heart

And the Remembrance (Dhikr) of Allah is what secures its side and one knows that there is no opportunity for the Devil (Shaytan) in it, and a thing is not treated except by its opposite, and the opposite of all the whisperings (Waswas) of the Devil (...
